title: Muslin
summary: Muslin (/ˈmʌzlɪn/) is a cotton fabric of plain weave.[1] It is made in a wide range of weights from delicate sheers to coarse sheeting.[2] It gets its name from the city of Mosul, in Iraq, where it was first manufactured.[3][4][5] In the 17th and 18th centuries Dacca in Bengal was regarded as producing the finest muslins.
